definition.shortDescription: Represents various types of artifacts (research, custom, image) created, processed, and managed within meetings.
definition.ubiquitousLanguage: Artifact refers to any content piece generated or managed during a meeting, including research notes, custom content, and images.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Human-readable name of the artifact

fields.name: slug
fields.description: Unique, immutable identifier for the artifact

fields.name: type
fields.description: Specifies the artifact subtype

fields.name: instructions
fields.description: Instructions or prompts used to create the artifact

fields.name: text
fields.description: Main content of the artifact (for research and custom types)

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL to the generated image (for image artifacts)

fields.name: status
fields.description: Current processing status of the artifact

fields.name: format
fields.description: Content format of the artifact

fields.name: sources
fields.type: Array<{ uri?: string; title?: string; snippet?: string }>
fields.description: Optional list of source references for research or custom artifacts

fields.name: description
fields.description: Optional descriptive text about the artifact

fields.name: errorMessage
fields.description: Error details if artifact processing failed

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Timestamp when artifact was created

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Timestamp when artifact was last updated

fields.name: prompt
fields.description: Prompt used for image generation (image artifacts only)

fields.name: aspectRatio
fields.description: Aspect ratio of the image artifact

fields.name: mimeType
fields.description: MIME type of the image artifact

relationships.description: Artifacts belong to a MeetingState which manages their lifecycle and status.
CustomArtifact is a subtype of Artifact with specific fields and status management.
ArtifactService manages operations such as finding pending artifacts, marking them in progress, and executing artifact creation.

invariants.rule: slug must be unique and immutable for each artifact
invariants.notes: Used as the primary identifier for artifact operations

invariants.rule: status must be one of the defined states
invariants.notes: Ensures consistent lifecycle management

invariants.rule: type must be one of 'research', 'custom', or 'image'
invariants.notes: Defines the artifact subtype and associated fields

commands.name: findPendingArtifacts
commands.description: Retrieve all custom artifacts currently in 'pending' status

commands.name: markInProgress
commands.description: Mark specified artifacts as 'in_progress' to prevent duplicate processing

commands.name: executeBatch
commands.description: Execute a batch of artifact creation or update requests

events.name: artifact.start
events.description: Triggered when artifact generation begins

events.name: artifact.update.start
events.description: Triggered when artifact update begins

events.name: artifact.completed
events.description: Triggered when artifact generation completes successfully

events.name: artifact.failed
events.description: Triggered when artifact generation fails

definition.shortDescription: Represents the meeting domain including participants, agenda, sections, notes, and state management.
definition.ubiquitousLanguage: Meeting, Participant, Artifact, ResearchArtifact, CustomArtifact, ImageArtifact, MeetingState, LlmContext, ProcessMeetingResult

fields.name: participants
fields.description: List of participants involved in the meeting, including host information.

fields.name: agenda
fields.description: Agenda items or sections of the meeting.

fields.name: notes
fields.description: Notes generated or taken during the meeting.

fields.name: state
fields.description: Current state of the meeting including artifacts and progress.

fields.name: artifacts
fields.description: Collection of artifacts related to the meeting such as research, custom content, and images.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the meeting.

relationships.description: Meeting aggregates multiple MeetingParticipants who can be hosts or attendees.
Meeting contains multiple Artifacts (ResearchArtifact, CustomArtifact, ImageArtifact) representing outputs or content generated during the meeting.
MeetingState manages the lifecycle and current data of the meeting including artifacts and notes.
LlmContext provides contextual information such as meeting title, participants, and chat text to support processing.

invariants.rule: Each artifact must have a unique and immutable slug identifier.
invariants.notes: Ensures artifacts can be reliably referenced and updated.

invariants.rule: At least one participant must be marked as host.
invariants.notes: A meeting requires a host to manage or lead the session.

invariants.rule: Artifact status must be one of 'pending', 'in_progress', 'completed', or 'failed'.
invariants.notes: Maintains consistent artifact lifecycle states.

commands.name: AddParticipant
commands.description: Add a new participant to the meeting.

commands.name: RemoveParticipant
commands.description: Remove an existing participant from the meeting.

commands.name: UpdateMeetingState
commands.description: Update the current state of the meeting including artifacts and notes.

commands.name: AddArtifact
commands.description: Add a new artifact (research, custom, or image) to the meeting.

commands.name: ProcessMeetingState
commands.description: Process the meeting state using LLM environment and context to generate notes, artifacts, and updates.

events.name: ParticipantAdded
events.description: Triggered when a participant is added to the meeting.

events.name: ParticipantRemoved
events.description: Triggered when a participant is removed from the meeting.

events.name: ArtifactCreated
events.description: Triggered when a new artifact is created and added to the meeting.

events.name: MeetingStateProcessed
events.description: Triggered after the meeting state has been processed and updated.

definition.shortDescription: Represents user sessions including state, scheduling, broadcasting, and session lifecycle management.
definition.ubiquitousLanguage: Session, SessionState, Participants, Transcript, Broadcast, Scheduling, Lifecycle, Cost, Assistant, Camera

fields.name: sessionId
fields.description: Unique identifier for the session.

fields.name: notes
fields.description: Session notes or annotations.

fields.name: stateV2
fields.description: Current detailed meeting state including transcript, sections, and artifacts.

fields.name: cameraEnabled
fields.description: Flag indicating if camera view is enabled.

fields.name: clients
fields.description: Set of connected client streams for broadcasting session updates.

fields.name: debugClients
fields.description: Set of debug client streams.

fields.name: dirty
fields.description: Indicates if the session state has unsaved changes.

fields.name: lastLLMAt
fields.description: Timestamp of last large language model (LLM) interaction.

fields.name: nextScheduledAt
fields.description: Timestamp for next scheduled summarization or processing.

fields.name: llmGenerationCounter
fields.description: Counter for LLM generation attempts.

fields.name: latestAppliedGeneration
fields.description: Latest applied generation number from LLM.

fields.name: debugLog
fields.description: Debug logging utility for session events.

fields.name: recallBotId
fields.description: Identifier for associated recall bot.

fields.name: cameraUrl
fields.description: URL for camera feed if applicable.

fields.name: orgId
fields.description: Organization identifier owning the session.

fields.name: deleted
fields.description: Flag indicating if the session is deleted.

fields.name: botStatus
fields.type: { code: string; subCode?: string | null; updatedAt?: string | null } | null
fields.description: Current status of the assistant bot.

fields.name: costTotals
fields.type: { inputCostUsd: number; thinkingCostUsd: number; outputCostUsd: number; totalCostUsd: number; byModel: Record<string, number> }
fields.description: Cost tracking for LLM usage and other session-related expenses.

fields.name: participants
fields.type: Map<string, { id: string; name: string; lastSeenAtMs: number }>
fields.description: Map of participant IDs to participant details.

fields.name: chat
fields.type: Array<{ ts: number; participantId?: string; participantName?: string; text: string }>
fields.description: Chat messages within the session.

fields.name: startedAtMs
fields.description: Timestamp when the session started.

fields.name: endedAtMs
fields.description: Timestamp when the session ended.

fields.name: assistant
fields.type: { isRunning: boolean; streamBegan: boolean; gen: number | null }
fields.description: Assistant bot runtime state.

fields.name: context
fields.description: Contextual information for the session.

fields.name: seq
fields.description: Sequence number for broadcast events.

relationships.description: SessionState manages the internal state and lifecycle of a Session aggregate root.
Session interacts with connected clients via broadcasting events such as notes, camera updates, transcripts, and assistant status.
Session persists data to the database via upsertSession, including participants, costs, timestamps, and identifiers.
Session schedules summarization and other periodic tasks using alarms and scheduling logic.
Session coordinates with assistant bot components and camera handlers.

invariants.rule: Session must have a unique sessionId.
invariants.notes: Ensures identity and consistency across storage and broadcasting.

invariants.rule: Deleted sessions must reject all requests except idempotent delete operations.
invariants.notes: Prevents operations on removed sessions.

invariants.rule: Broadcast sequence number (seq) must increment monotonically.
invariants.notes: Ensures clients receive ordered event streams.

invariants.rule: Session state must be loaded from storage before processing requests.
invariants.notes: Prevents stale or inconsistent state handling.

invariants.rule: Cost totals must be accurately tracked and persisted.
invariants.notes: Supports billing and usage reporting.

invariants.rule: Scheduling alarms must respect minimum intervals to avoid excessive LLM calls.
invariants.notes: Protects system resources and rate limits.

commands.name: fetch
commands.description: Handles incoming HTTP requests to the session Durable Object, routing to appropriate handlers.

commands.name: handleDelete
commands.description: Deletes the session, marking it as deleted and cleaning up resources.

commands.name: handleInit
commands.description: Initializes a new session with starting parameters.

commands.name: handleIngest
commands.description: Processes incoming transcript or data ingestion.

commands.name: handleNotes
commands.description: Updates session notes.

commands.name: handleCamera
commands.description: Manages camera state and updates.

commands.name: handleStatus
commands.description: Returns current session status.

commands.name: maybeScheduleSummarize
commands.description: Schedules summarization tasks based on session state and timing constraints.

commands.name: executeAlarm
commands.description: Executes scheduled summarization or processing when alarm fires.

commands.name: broadcast
commands.description: Sends session state updates to all connected clients.

commands.name: broadcastAssistant
commands.description: Sends assistant bot status updates to clients.

events.name: sessionStarted
events.description: Emitted when a session is initialized and started.

events.name: sessionEnded
events.description: Emitted when a session is ended.

events.name: sessionDeleted
events.description: Emitted when a session is marked as deleted.

events.name: notesUpdated
events.description: Emitted when session notes are updated.

events.name: transcriptUpdated
events.description: Emitted when new transcript data is ingested.

events.name: cameraUpdated
events.description: Emitted when camera state or data changes.

events.name: assistantStatusChanged
events.description: Emitted when assistant bot status changes.

events.name: sessionBroadcasted
events.description: Emitted when session state is broadcast to clients.

events.name: sessionSummarized
events.description: Emitted after summarization task completes.

definition.shortDescription: Handles normalization and processing of recall webhook payloads and manages recall bot lifecycle and camera control.
definition.ubiquitousLanguage: Recall bot, recall webhook payload, normalized transcript, normalized chat, recall session, camera control

fields.name: RecallNormalizedTranscriptPayload
fields.description: Normalized transcript data from recall webhook including words, participant info, and session context.

fields.name: RecallNormalizedChatPayload
fields.description: Normalized chat message data from recall webhook including text, participant info, and timestamps.

fields.name: RecallNormalizedPayload
fields.description: Union type representing either transcript or chat normalized payload.

fields.name: RecallNormalizedStatus
fields.description: Status update payload from recall webhook indicating bot status codes and timestamps.

relationships.description: Recall service consumes raw webhook payloads and normalizes them into RecallNormalizedPayload types.
Recall service manages lifecycle of recall bots by creating them with meeting URLs, webhook URLs, and camera URLs.
RecallNormalizedPayloads are used downstream for transcript processing, chat handling, and session management.

invariants.rule: Every normalized payload must include a valid botId.
invariants.notes: Normalization returns null if botId is missing.

invariants.rule: Recall bot creation requires valid meetingUrl, webhookUrl, and cameraUrl.
invariants.notes: API key must be present in environment for authorization.

commands.name: createRecallBot
commands.description: Creates a new recall bot instance with specified meeting URL, webhook URL, camera URL, and optional session ID.

events.name: transcript.data
events.description: Event emitted when transcript data is available from the recall bot.

events.name: participant_events.chat_message
events.description: Event emitted when a participant sends a chat message.

implementation.label: Recall webhook normalization and payload types
Recall bot lifecycle management and creation

definition.shortDescription: Represents research requests and results, including execution and integration with Gemini grounding.
definition.ubiquitousLanguage: Research refers to the process of submitting research requests, executing them via an LLM grounded with Google Search, and managing the lifecycle and results of these research tasks within meeting artifacts.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Unique identifier or title of the research request.

fields.name: instructions
fields.description: Detailed instructions or topic description for the research.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Current state of the research task (e.g., pending, in_progress, completed, failed).

fields.name: text
fields.description: Concise bullet point summary of the research results.

fields.name: sources
fields.type: Array<{uri?: string; title?: string; snippet?: string}>
fields.description: List of source references used to ground the research results.

fields.name: errorMessage
fields.description: Error message if the research execution failed.

fields.name: cost
fields.type: {inputCostUsd: number; outputCostUsd: number; totalCostUsd: number; model: string}
fields.description: Cost details of the LLM call for the research.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Timestamp of the last update to the research artifact.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: Optional unique slug or identifier for the research artifact.

relationships.description: Research artifacts are part of the MeetingState artifacts collection.
ResearchService interacts with LLMEnv to execute research requests.
Research execution integrates with Gemini LLM via callGeminiWithGrounding for grounded research.

invariants.rule: A research artifact must have a unique name or slug within the meeting state.
invariants.notes: Ensures correct identification and prevents duplicate processing.

invariants.rule: Only research artifacts with status 'pending' can be marked 'in_progress'.
invariants.notes: Prevents duplicate or concurrent execution of the same research task.

invariants.rule: Research results must include a concise bullet point summary in Markdown format.
invariants.notes: Maintains consistency and clarity of research output.

commands.name: findPendingResearch
commands.description: Retrieve all research artifacts currently in 'pending' status.

commands.name: markInProgress
commands.description: Mark specified research artifacts as 'in_progress' to lock them for execution.

commands.name: executeBatch
commands.description: Execute a batch of research requests and return their results.

events.name: research.start
events.description: Emitted when a research task begins execution, includes metadata for debugging.

definition.shortDescription: Handles image generation requests and results, including batch execution and image service management.
definition.ubiquitousLanguage: ImageArtifact, ImageRequest, ImageResult, executeBatch, markInProgress, applyResults

fields.name: env
fields.description: Environment configuration and credentials required for image generation services.

relationships.description: Interacts with MeetingState to find, update, and apply image artifacts.
Uses ImageRequest and ImageResult types to represent image generation inputs and outputs.
Delegates image generation execution to executor module functions like executeImageBatch.

invariants.rule: Only ImageArtifacts with status 'pending' can be marked as 'in_progress'.
invariants.notes: Ensures images are processed only once per batch execution.

invariants.rule: ImageResult must correspond to an existing ImageArtifact by slug.
invariants.notes: Prevents applying results to non-existent or unrelated artifacts.

invariants.rule: Environment variables VERTEX_PROJECT and AI_GATEWAY_BASE must be configured before execution.
invariants.notes: Required for successful image generation calls.

commands.name: findPendingImages
commands.description: Retrieve all image artifacts in the 'pending' state from a meeting.

commands.name: markInProgress
commands.description: Update specified image artifacts' status to 'in_progress' in the meeting state.

commands.name: executeBatch
commands.description: Execute a batch of image generation requests asynchronously, returning results.

commands.name: applyResults
commands.description: Apply image generation results to the meeting state, updating artifacts accordingly.

events.name: image.start
events.description: Emitted when an image generation request starts.

events.name: image.update.start
events.description: Emitted when an image update request starts.
